intro: Popowia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar popowia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the island's unique climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
